@upnorthwi The reason that EQT could do well is because they believe that the latest acquisition will drop costs 25%.  So the breakeven point for natural gas will go below $2 (significantly below).  Furthermore, with each acquisition they also made sure to get midstream assets (with connections) because AR was getting much better money for its gas while  EQT was stuck in an oversupplied basin.  Now with the latest acquisition, that process should be near completion.  EQT will be giving AR a run for its money (so to speak).The Rice Brothers have done well at previous attempts at building and selling companies.  This one looks to be on track as well.  But it is a growth story and not really an income story.

@Rhoda711 I was still ticked off with loss of income and sold for NXG. Going back to 9/1/24 they're both pretty much even in performance, but NXG is a 14.6% monthly vs 1.7% quarterly. Yes, EQT may become a star, but for me, I'm happy.
